comments.body: I assume that this is not a huge deal because the node will begin reporting that the volume is mounted -- accurate?  If so, I think that it could use a comment to that effect.

Node will be happy since it will see the disk show up and will assume it is attached, which it is. The controller will assume that it is still not attached, and will continue trying to attach it (retrying), which will succeed since the disk is already attached and hopefully it won't fail here on the retry, if it does, it'll retry.
the line below this is collapsing an error state and a non-error state, if I'm not mistaken.
As far as this code is concerned these volumes must be attachable. So an error or the plugin not being attachable are all errors and handled as such.

regarding package layout.  Could we (maybe after this) reorg to

```
pkg/controller/volume
  +-- persistent  (Jan's mega PR, now merged)
  +-- attach (this)
      +-- other util pkgs
```
